channel.title: Actually getting on the server
channel.description:
I have downloaded a source + client, and i have also made a no-ip/portforwarded, and it says the ports are open on canuseeme, but i cant actually login to the server, it says "no response from server please use a different world".
This has happened with the majority of sources/clients which i have tried to get onto, and i was wondering if anyone would be able to help me to get onto the server so i can start learning how to code.
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Actually getting on the server
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

Solved

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @rarffen rarffen
item.description:
@rarffen wrote:

looted y00:

The entire client folder… they go in it and click on run

okay thanks

EDIT: ok so i did that, and i have changed the ips in the “client.java” folder to the ip of the no-ip, but do i change them to the actual digits or the actual name of the no-ip which is “garrsps.no-ip.biz”?

Read full topic

item.title: Actually getting on the server
item.dc:creator: @rarffen rarffen
item.description:
@rarffen wrote:

i am running the source, utorrent is running, my no-ip is running, ive changed the ips in the client to the ip of the no-ip. and i have also checked if the ports are open on canyouseeme, and it says they are.

But i think the problem is that i have uploaded the wrong files for my friends to download, can anyone help me with what i need to upload which will allow them to play?

Read full topic

item.title: Actually getting on the server

@RsMakerWoad wrote:

Make sure you run your source first :eek:

Read full topic

item.title: Actually getting on the server
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

Yes it does matter because he wants players & if he is using utorrent to portforward that program is alreadying using port 43594 which is disabling him to connect to the client. Also, it could be that he’s trying to connect to his no-ip instead of localhost as he posted in his last comment. Rarffen exit out of utorrent the whole program & reset the no-ip to 127.0.0.1 compile then try and login or pm teamviewer details

Read full topic

item.title: Actually getting on the server
item.dc:creator: @Jaxus Jaxus
item.description:
@Jaxus wrote:

It doesn’t matter whether he portforwarded or not. Obviously the server is reachable if it is sending the no response return code, so at least we know that the server -> client packets are working; however, in this case it seems the server is denying packets being sent from the client. This means that your connection is either IP banned, which is the only time that certain response code should be sent out (from my knowledge of the 317 protocol).

I have a few questions for you that might increase my ability to help you:

[ul][li]Where is the server hosted at? (Your computer, virtual private server, etc.)[/li]
[li]Were you able to connect to that certain server with the same exact client at any previous point of time?[/li][/ul]

Read full topic

item.title: Actually getting on the server
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

im guessing you didnt portforward right check to see if it can see your service at canyouseeme.org

item.title: Actually getting on the server
item.dc:creator: @rarffen rarffen
item.description:
@rarffen wrote:

[quote=“ultimatepkvillage, post:8, topic:455394”][quote author=rarffen link=topic=558293.msg4083449#msg4083449 date=1345568319]
i’ve already tried changing the ip to 127.0.0.1 in the client.java folder, are there any other folders which would need to be changed?

sorry im new to this stuff :[
[/quote]

okay did you portforward with utorrent or your router?[/quote]

i portforwarded with both, but i have the server up now, but i cant get other people to connect to it, ive changed the "server = to the ip of the no-ip, and i have uploaded this to mediafire for friends to download, but when they try to connect to the server it says its offline.

Read full topic

item.title: Actually getting on the server
item.dc:creator: @Devastational Devastational
item.description:
@Devastational wrote:

Have you :

Compiled
Got the cache downloader correct
Signlink correct
IP’s correct
No-IP correct
Portforwarding correct
Allowing exceptions through your firewall

If you haven’t done any I’ll be glad to you help with them I think they’re the main things you need to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Actually getting on the server
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

[quote=“rarffen, post:3, topic:455394”][quote author=iz3 legend link=topic=558293.msg4083383#msg4083383 date=1345560857]
You have to connect from the default IP (0.0.0.0) and others connect from the one you set on No-IP. The port stays the same on both.
[/quote]

so i have to change the ip in client.java to 0.0.0.0, and the other one to my no-ip?[/quote]

make a copy of the client folder in one of the folders make the ip set to 127.0.0.1 so you can and the copy folder set to your no-ip so you can release it

Read full topic
